alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 22 at 3:23PM EDT until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Maryland, including the following areas, Dorchester, Inland Worcester, Maryland Beaches, Somerset and Wicomico. Portions of Virginia, including the following areas, Accomack, Lancaster, Middlesex, Northumberland, Richmond and Westmoreland. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected to develop across eastern Virginia and the Maryland Eastern Shore this afternoon through early Sunday as Tropical Storm Ophelia moves towards the area. Rainfall amounts of 3 to 4 inches are expected with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Accomack; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland
